message: Any "natives" know about / could find out about / can recommend a prepaid SIM with data available?
Bonus points for a micro-sim I can use in my iPhone.
Triple bonus points for buying one for me and letting me pay you for it at PyCon ;-)
I believe http://www.mysimplemobile.com/ operates on t-mobile's GSM network and offers prepaid no contract data sims.  no idea if they have micro-sims.
That would be cool. 10 days unlimited data would be what I need. I leave on Tuesday, so too late to order SIM cutter in the UK.
Why do I always try and sort these things out too late. :-)
As far as buying, I think you can do that yourself --- I'm going to see if I can get one of the bigger T-Mobile stores to come down and setup to sell for a couple of hours as a convenience.
At least for T-Mobile, here are some prepaid card options:  (hang on to your hat):

You can buy a dollar amount card.  You can re-plenish it from your phone, with a credit card.    I got one of these for someone last year, and they re-filled it from their phone.  $22.00USD I think gave 30 minutes of talk.   Whatever....
I NEED A VOLUNTER:  Someone from Atlanta area coming to the conference to accept an amazon package, and bring it with them to the conference (small - sim cutter)
Ok - here's the deal.

As far as the "micro-sim" --- there's a cutter / adapter to accomplish this, which the T-Mobile stores here know about, but don't have (so they have experience w/ customers having success).   I'm going to order a cutter, and some pile of adapters to have available at the conference.
$35 is harsh

The other T-Mobile option is a one-month unlimited talk & text, 2G data card for $70USD   The Atlanta stores tell me they have a limited number of these, as they are specially programmed (about 8-10 per store; 3 stores in Atlanta area)
I hope I didn't speak too soon:  Amazon doesn't stock these; not sure when a cutter would arrive.   (Checking)
Yeah - I'm looking at which of the Amazon vendors that have the cutter are reliable, and will ship "overnight" (I leave Tuesday also)
$10 sim I can get before I leave - I know from last year that you can "load additional" on it (like the 24hr data)  from the sim/your phone, with your own credit card.
Yep
yeah - I can have delivered to hotel - and pay the $35 (??) fee... or maybe ask one of our Atlanta locals to take delivery.... ??? Who's in Atlanta?
or Brandon...
@yarkot depending on how much the daily allowance is, the per day options sounds ideal.
Doug wossisname (not Napoleone the other one) is a local.

@voidspace - I think you / we can get one there (in Atlanta) but I'm certainly willing to buy a pre-paid, and just have it for you.    Regardless, I'm ordering a sim-cutter w/ adapters (and probably some extra adapters) and will have this at the registration desk.
So the options are $1.49 per day for ???? amount of data or $70 for 2Gb valid for a month?

The deal:   24hr data plan, refilled from your phone is $1.49 per day.   If you buy a card w/ enough to cover the conference, then you're "all set" - inasmuch as I don't know how well it works in downtown Atlanta (I have T-Mobile in Chicago, and use data to make my train commute "office time" - speed varies radically with your location)
yeah - I have an ex-motorola friend who lives in Atlanta, but would rather have someone who is coming....  Hellman...
@yarkot I arrive Tuesday evening
Sounds good. Resorting to email. :-)
$!.49 24hr unlimited data
sorrry $1.49
but you must have a SIM card (buy separate - prepaid:  $10 for 10 minutes talk; $22 for 30 minutes;  other increments)
cutter comes w/ 3 sim adapters;  separately they are $2.49 from a higher-rated vendor, $0.99 from a lower...      I might get 10 extra just to have around, if I think I can get them here by monday
If you have the opportunity. Otherwise try and sort it out on arrival I guess.
And I'll chip for the cutter of course.
I'll tweet this out too.... then I can order today.
Hero
... premature to say --- let's see if the sim cutter (less important, tho I wouldn't want to do a hand cut, it's possible)  and adapters (necessary) get there.
okeydokey
VM summit on Wedensday
How does one get an invite to that anyway?  Been watching it on the side for 3 yrs now...
Amazon UK has cutters for about £7 - next day delivery would arrive with me on Wednesday though. :-)
Hellmann!
If you could get me a pre-paid SIM with $10 of talk time and 10 days unlimited internet setup then I will happily, joyfully and gratefully reimburse you.
tweet/buzzed/etc...
@voidspace - so you're coming in Tuesday, or Wednesday?
Anyone else coming in that could use an iPhone SIM adapter, let us know here.
Language summit on Thursday
... so I should think about getting active on core...   been thinking about it;
ah, you would be most welcome indeed
language summit is for core-commiters of cpython plus core developers of other implementations and a few randoms (mainly those who package python for linux distros)
vm summit is for core developers of dynamic language VMs
I was looking at net10 for a prepaid card. They're advertising a $50 unlimited talk, voice & text  plan. I'm pretty sure they run on AT&T's network.

I used them for a talk and text plan (with one of their cheap prepaid phones) last year and it worked alright. I'm tempted to go with them again if for no other reason than i aready have the sim. Anyone know anything about their data service?
@gg - doesn't look like they have data plans
FWIW - T-mobile advertises 4G in Atlanta;
heh, iPhone doesn't do 4G anyway, so no good to me
If you don't have a volunteer by now, I can accept an amazon package. I live less than 5 min from the conference.

I believe the mysimplemobile option is $60 for 1gig data for a month, unlimited everything else (again, it runs on tmobile's network, so really its just $10 less for 1gig less).  It looks like they have several retailers in Atlanta but as I have no experience with any of this beyond knowing that it exists. sim cutting would be required.

Also FYI your iphone might only get 2G edge speeds on tmobile in the US; at&t and tmobile use different incompatible frequencies for their US 3G networks and I've yet to see any phone hardware from any vendor that supports _both_.
@khightower - thanks;   I found a part number that amazon ships itself, and have it coming overnight, so will bring with me.
@voidspace:  re 4G - no worries; fallback to 3G too...  it's all there up to HSPA+
